questionListItems.title: Can I enjoy subsidies for Healthier SG Chronic Tier, if I enrol with a polyclinic rather than a GP clinic?

answer.body:
From February 2024, Healthier SG Chronic Tier subsidies will be available at your enrolled Healthier SG GP clinic. Please click here for details of the Healthier SG Chronic Tier.

 

There is no change to the prevailing subsidies at polyclinics.

questionListItems.title: How do I view and access my Health Plan?

answer.body:
A digital summary of your Health Plan can be viewed and accessed on the HealthHub app after your first consultation.


Follow the steps below to view your Health Plan in HealthHub.


For recommended health programmes offered by community partners, you can use the direct link function within the HealthHub app to access Healthy 365 app conveniently and see what activities are available near you. Alternatively, you may download the Healthy 365 app from your app store.


If you do not have a smartphone to access the HealthHub app, you may request your clinic to print out a copy of your Health Plan for you.

questionListItems.title: If I do not have a smartphone, how can I sign up for the programmes and keep track of it?

answer.body: If you or your loved ones do not have access to a smartphone or the Healthy 365 app, you may approach the nearest Community Club (CC), Active Ageing Centre (AAC) or ActiveSG Sport Centres for assistance with the booking of programmes.

questionListItems.title: Why should Pioneer Generation (PG) and Merdeka Generation (MG) cardholders still apply for CHAS, when they enrol into Healthier SG? What is the Healthier SG Chronic Tier benefits for them?

answer.body:
From early 2024, PG and MG seniors enrolled with the Healthier SG GP clinics can access the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier subsidy framework, where they can enjoy access to selected chronic medications, similar to those prescribed and subsidised at polyclinics, at prices more comparable to polyclinics.

 

Under this framework, PG and MG seniors can receive 87.5% and 81.25% subsidy (with no dollar cap) respectively for selected chronic medications. They will also receive subsidies of up to $360 per year for other components of their chronic care, such as consultation, lab tests and medications that are not part of the list of selected chronic medications.

 

Patients who are more likely to benefit from the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier are those with chronic conditions with higher medication needs and bills which exceed the current CHAS annual subsidy limits. Hence, patients are encouraged to consult their family doctors if they are suitable to switch to the selected chronic medications that are eligible for percentage subsidies under the Healthier SG Chronic Tier.

 

To cater for possible changes to their medical needs, patients will be allowed to switch between the original CHAS Chronic Tier and the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier. Should there be a switch between subsidy frameworks, the annual dollar subsidy balance will be pro-rated accordingly.

 

PG and MG seniors are nonetheless encouraged to sign up for the CHAS card as MOH continues to review enrolment benefits under Healthier SG.

 

Healthier SG benefits and subsidies are available/accessible at your enrolled Healthier SG clinic.

questionListItems.title:
How can I access HealthHub and Healthier SG-related functions on behalf of my loved ones?
Can I assist my family members to enrol in Healthier SG?
Can we enrol our care recipients or family members?

answer.body:
Yes, with the consent of your family members, you can be given access to help them enrol in Healthier SG and view their Health Plans on the HealthHub app.

Please follow the steps in the below graphics to set up access as a caregiver on your care recipient's HealthHub app.



Please ensure that your care recipient have enabled "Healthier SG" access in the Caregiver's Details page (as shown in Step 5).


Next, you can then add your care recipient (or loved ones) under "People under my care".


After it has been added successfully, you can view your care recipient's user profile in the Health Profiles page. You may continue to assist your loved ones to enrol in Healthier SG and access Healthier SG related functions on their behalf by following the below steps.


For more information on how to add a caregiver and control your caregiver's access to your health records, please refer to the HealthHub FAQs under the section "Caregiver Access".

questionListItems.title: Who do I contact should I need to amend my appointments for referrals?

answer.body: Please inform the clinic you were referred to that you would like to change your appointment. If you are unsure of the clinic you were referred to, please contact your enrolled Healthier SG GP clinic for clarification.

questionListItems.title: Where can I seek technical assistance on the HealthHub app?

answer.body:
You may:

  • refer to the HealthHub FAQs,

  • call HealthHub contact centre at 1800 225 4482 or

  • send an email to contact_us@healthhub.sg.

questionListItems.title: How will my attendance at Healthier SG programmes be tracked?

answer.body: Your attendance will be taken through the Healthy 365 app and/or during the programmes by the programme facilitators.

questionListItems.title: How often will my Health Plan be reviewed?

answer.body: Your family clinic will have an annual check-in with you based on your Health Plan and to discuss any changes or next steps you wish to take. If you have chronic conditions, you can expect to have more frequent check-ins with your family clinic as guided by the care protocols and based on your doctor's assessment.

questionListItems.title: Will my referral results be automatically sent to my family clinic for review?

answer.body: Not all your clinical results by other care providers will be automatically sent to your family clinic. As such, it is good practice to always bring your clinical results physically during your appointments.

questionListItems.title: Will all my health records and screening/tests results be viewable on HealthHub app?

answer.body:
HealthHub retrieves your health records such as screening and lab test results from the medical records system of various public healthcare institutions, such as polyclinics and public structured hospitals.


For more information on the types of health records, you may refer to the HealthHub FAQs.

questionListItems.title: If I do not have a smartphone, mobile number nor any caregiver, how do I redeem my Healthpoints?

answer.body:
You may approach our Healthier SG ambassadors at the HSG Enrolment Stations, IMDA ambassadors at IMDA digital hubs at the Community Centres, Libraries or staff at the Active Ageing Centres for assistance to set up your Healthy 365 account within 12 months after the first Health Plan consultation with your doctor, to receive 3,000 Healthpoints (worth $20). Once the Healthpoints are credited into your Healthy 365 account, each Healthpoint is valid for 6 months.  

 

For more information on the locations please click below:

 

  • Healthier SG enrolment stations

  • IMDA digital hubs

  • Active Ageing Centres (for 60 years old and above)

questionListItems.title: What are the selected chronic medications that are eligible for percentage subsidies under Healthier SG Chronic Tier?

answer.body:
Commonly used medications for managing chronic conditions such as diabetes, high blood pressure and high cholesterol will be subsidised under Healthier SG Chronic Tier and will be available from February 2024. Prices for these medications at the GPs will be more comparable with the polyclinics.

 

You may find the list of selected chronic medications that are eligible for the percentage-based subsidies under Healthier SG Chronic Tier here.

questionListItems.title: If I collect my medication at my Healthier SG GP clinic with an external prescription, will I still be entitled for the subsidies?

answer.body: Yes, however, the GP may charge you a prescription filling administrative fee or a consultation fee.
